str2: Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To direct my gaze, look steadily. From a compound of a and teino; to gaze intently.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
